decks.notes: This deck focuses on building a strong board presence early in the game with aggressive creature plays like Dennick, Pious Apprentice and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. It also utilizes powerful cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor for additional advantage. The deck aims to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy with removal spells like Go for the Throat. The land base is designed to support the deck's aggressive playstyle while providing flexibility for casting spells of different colors.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells and powerful creatures. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Obliterating Bolt and Abrade while using cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to gain advantage and pressure the opponent. Graveyard Trespasser and Bloodtithe Harvester provide additional threats and resources. The land base is designed to provide a mix of colors to cast the spells in the deck efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and win through attrition.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and disruption, utilizing a mix of powerful creatures and removal spells to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. The creatures in the deck have abilities that help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also providing a solid aggressive front. The deck also includes a variety of land cards to ensure consistent mana production. Ultimately, the goal of this deck is to control the board through disruption and aggression, paving the way for a swift victory.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells like Infernal Grasp, Go for the Throat, and Abrade. It also utilizes cards like Reckoner Bankbuster and Bloodtithe Harvester to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Corpse Appraiser, the deck can generate value and pressure the opponent. The versatile Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can provide card advantage or board presence as needed. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its strategy and ensure consistent casting of its spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a Rakdos color combination, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and removal spells. The key strategy is to apply pressure early with efficient threats like Bloodthirsty Adversary and Reckless Stormseeker, while using removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse adds additional late-game threats to ensure the deck can close out games quickly. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of Mountains and Swamps alongside dual lands to ensure consistent access to the color requirements of the deck.

The main concept of this Rakdos Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the game using removal spells, powerful creatures, and graveyard manipulation. By combining efficient removal like Go for the Throat and Infernal Grasp with graveyard synergies from cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. Additionally, powerful finishers like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester can help close out the game once the opponent's resources are depleted. The deck is designed to maintain control of the board and resources while setting up a winning position.

The deck focuses on utilizing heavy control elements, with a strong emphasis on removal and disruption. It includes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Ob Nixilis, the Adversary to control the board and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also features cards like Invoke Despair and Go for the Throat for removal, while maintaining card advantage with Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The inclusion of cards like Archfiend of the Dross and Tenacious Underdog provide powerful finishers, while the mana base allows for consistent casting of spells.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and spells. The key strategy involves utilizing creatures with evasion, such as flying or unblockable abilities, to deal damage while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes cards that can protect your creatures or generate additional advantage. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they can recover.

This deck focuses on using Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to cheat out powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Atraxa, Grand Unifier from the graveyard. It also includes cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Reckoner Bankbuster to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect your creatures. The deck has a mix of removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, as well as card draw and tutoring effects to help find key combo pieces. Overall, the goal is to reanimate big threats and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, card draw, and powerful threats. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Go for the Throat and Drag to the Bottom, while generating value and advantage through cards like Courier's Briefcase and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Atraxa, Grand Unifier provides a powerful threat that can quickly end the game if left unchecked. The deck also includes some land destruction elements with cards like Raffine's Tower and Ziatora's Proving Ground to further disrupt the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on powerful aggro creatures in the Azorius colors, with a mix of efficient creatures and combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to maintain a fast and aggressive board presence while using protection spells to ensure the safety of your creatures. The deck also includes some cards for card advantage and evasion to keep the pressure on the opponent. With a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful support spells, this deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures, then bringing them back to the battlefield with reanimation spells to overwhelm the opponent. The strategy involves a combination of sacrificing creatures, discarding cards, and removal spells to set up big plays with powerful creatures. The deck also utilizes cards that provide additional value when creatures enter the battlefield, creating a synergistic combo that can quickly turn the tide of the game in the player's favor. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outpace the opponent with a well-timed reanimation strategy.
